bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence Reed, September 28, 1950

div1.p: Hench thanks Lawrence Reed for informing him about Blossom Reed's illness, and notes that her last letter to him suggested that she was under a strain.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence Reed, September 28, 1950
div1.opener:
September 28, 1950
Major General Walter L. Reed
2810 Thirty Sixth Place
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Reed:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for your letter of
September 17. I am so sorry to hear of Blossom's
indisposition and I am sure that it is temporary
as it has been in the past. I suspected that she
was under a strain. Her last letter sounded that
way and indeed she did discuss something about
her mother's possessions. I would like to dis-
cuss this with her sometime but certainly with
her present illness this is not the time to do it.
Mary and I leave for England, Scotland and Ireland
tomorrow, a very busy trip - 10 formal talks and
back in a month.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
